description: Schema reference for processed AI & ML training data generated from the collected raw datasets

data_directories.summary: Programming benchmarks (HumanEval, CodeAlpaca) for code reasoning prompts
Open-source instruction-following datasets such as Dolly and HHRLHF
Research distillation corpora and benchmark summaries
Critical reasoning datasets focused on alignment and factuality
Carefully curated empathetic dialogue transcripts for responsible model tuning
Cross-domain datasets intersecting AI with biosignal interpretation
Nutritional recommender datasets overlapping AI decision support
Structured CSV resources for feature engineering exemplars

expected_preprocessing_tasks: Convert parquet/CSV records into instruction-response JSONL
Tag each example with difficulty level and subscription tier

basic.system_prompt: You are an AI/ML tutor. Explain concepts clearly for beginners with practical examples and simple analogies.

professional.system_prompt: You are an AI/ML engineer. Provide technical implementation details, code examples, and mathematical foundations.

enterprise.system_prompt: You are an AI/ML architect. Design enterprise AI solutions with governance, ethics, and scalability considerations.

training_examples.input: Explain the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning for a coding bootcamp student.
training_examples.output: Supervised learning uses labelled datasets that pair inputs with the correct answers, allowing models to learn direct mappingsâ€”for example, mapping house features to sale prices. Unsupervised learning works without labels, finding hidden structure in the data such as grouping customers into segments based on purchasing behaviour. In supervised learning the goal is prediction, while in unsupervised learning the goal is discovery.
